Awesome!

The more people that use the library, the more bugfixes/features =
I'll
be able to add =3D)

If you have any issues or feedback, don't hesitat=
e to throw a message
on the board or e-mail me.

If all goes according to p=
lan, around the february/march timeframe I'm
going to release an update whi=
ch includes saving populations to gzip
files and integrated coevolution.

J=
ason G.

 From: Jason Gauci <jgmath2000@...>

> > 
> > I'm currently using my HyperNEAT library with Bo=
ost 1.34 so I'm sure
> > it's supported, as long as you made the appropriat=
e changes to the
> > makefile (which you obviously did).
> > 
> > It sounds=
 like the system can't find the boost library.  This is
> > either because =
you didn't install the boost library to a system path,
> > or because there=
 isn't a copy of the library in the same directory as
> > the executable.
>=
 > 
> > In linux, there's an environment variable called LD_LIBRARY_PATH wh=
ich
> > you can set to find extra libraries.  It should work for OS/X too.
=
> > 
> > Here's something you can try:
> > 
> > 1) Copy the boost threading=
 library to the directory of the HyperNEAT
> > executable.
> > 
> > 2) Run =
this:  LD_LIBRARY_PATH=3D"./" ./Hypercube_NEAT
> > 
> > 
> > P.S. If you di=
g up a better way to use the boost threading libraries
> > with cmake, plea=
se let me know.  Thanks!
> > 
> > Jason G.
> > 
> > --- In neat@yahoogroups=
.com, Jeff Clune <jclune@> wrote:

screwy is

 library.

anyone know

ld the library with OS/X yet.

> >>> It looks like you are having tro=
uble getting the boost libraries
> >>> linked in.
> >>> 
> >>> The problem =
is that the boost library has this complex naming
> >>> convention for its =
libraries and it is hard to write a script
that can
> >>> handle every poss=
ible case.  I believe that the creators of
cmake are
> >>> working on a scr=
ipt which is comprehensive enough to work on all
> > systems.
> >>> 
> >>> =
In the meantime, here is what you can do:
> >>> 
> >>> 1) Get the boost lib=
rary (either by building yourself or using a
> > binary)
> >>> 
> >>> 2) Fi=
nd out what library name the boost threading examples use.
> >>> 
> >>> 3) =
edit the CMakelists.txt inside the Hypercube_NEAT directory
and in
> >>> th=
e TARGET_LINK_LIBRARIES(...) section, replace the boost thread
> >>> librar=
y name with the appropriate name.
> >>>
